title: Autofill creates a toxic environment.
body:
https://image.prntscr.com/image/GCGvSrhrT8K0xmVHPUv_HA.png

Moral of the story: 2 players got autofilled, being Rengar and Riven. Riven insisted that they "Pick troll picks bot since they're not going to give us our roles", so she locked in Riven support, and Rengar made the decision of going jungle ANYWAYS, even though the person who was assigned jungle said "No". Love this community man, can't tell you how many times I get this in champion select.

replies.body:
Was it really so long ago that people were expected to be reasonably capable in all 5 roles when playing ranked? 

I distinctly recall a certain "Pick order" to choose lanes in the ranked queue. You know, the one where everyone who picked after the first person was an autofill.

> [{quoted}](name=BlueThingamajig,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gkYx6cVA,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-01-03T23:21:46.723+0000)
>
> Was it really so long ago that people were expected to be reasonably capable in all 5 roles when playing ranked? 
> 
> I distinctly recall a certain "Pick order" to choose lanes in the ranked queue. You know, the one where everyone who picked after the first person was an autofill.

You don't really ask a plumber to groom your dog. It's just not what he's good at. The old system was dumped because it was poorly designed. The new one is better, but there will always be people who are unhappy and try to ruin the experience regardless.

I agree with your comment, but have one caveat. 

If, for some highly unusual reason, that a plumber is obligated to groom a dog, I would expect it to be done and performed with a modicum of competence. Not have the plumber sabotage my kitchen sink, break shower handles, and be mean to the dog in the process.

If the plumber is truly averse to dog grooming, then they should flatly decline and leave (read: queue dodge). 

I guess some people will be unhappy and try to ruin the experience regardless.

I only meant that expecting everyone to have five professions ( especially as their off time hobby) was asking a little much, and Riot knew that and narrowed it down. 

Someone is probably always going to be unhappy, since some roles are in higher demand than others. But I really don't run across this enough for it to be an issue. I enjoy this version of champ select compared to the "fuck you Im first" pick order thing. xD

> [{quoted}](name=BlueThingamajig,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gkYx6cVA,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2018-01-03T23:21:46.723+0000)
>
> Was it really so long ago that people were expected to be reasonably capable in all 5 roles when playing ranked? 
> 
> I distinctly recall a certain "Pick order" to choose lanes in the ranked queue. You know, the one where everyone who picked after the first person was an autofill.

AS if pickorder was really a valid system. It was just a method; it was still up to you to ask politely to swap lanes and not to be a gigantic jerk to claim a lane and stick with it

> Was it really so long ago that people were expected to be reasonably capable in all 5 roles when playing ranked?

They weren't. Stop saying that. During those days, people would just screw you off with pick order or still instalock, and force you to play around them. You weren't expected to play all 5 roles because you could still just pick whatever you want and expect the team to comply and play around you.

Remember in those days when people would say "(insert role) or feed"? That happens a lot less these days.
That's why I main support. Because I can get it easy. Also because Thresh is really fun.

Just report both of them.
Yeah the issue is that removing autofill would mean having to wait 30minutes in queue until a support main wants to play.
The thing is that yeah, an autofilled player will certainly not carry the game, but he should use this situation to try and learn other champions and overall get better.
If they don't want to get autofilled then they have to try and play support for a game or two, with the intent of learning something new, focusing on macro and things like that, that way they'll be autofill protected

Here is a quote from [the summoner's code](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/game-info/get-started/summoners-code/) : 
>Be open minded when considering the needs of your team. If you're the last one to pick, try to fill a niche in your team that hasn't already been filled. If everyone's picked and something stands out as a deficiency in your team composition, try asking for another player to fill the gap, or change roles to embrace that responsibility yourself. **Remember, that by taking on a role you don't normally play, you'll learn more about unfamiliar champions and increase your own skill level.**

> Just report both of them.

The funny part is, unless they explicitly state that they're trolling or inting, they can't be punished, because it'll just be breaking the meta. You can go rengar "adc" with smite. As long as you don't actually jgl and play somewhat like an ADC, it's not punishable.

You can play support Riven, and even "accidently" take cs. Not reportable. Play badly, but don't obviously int, and you'll get away with it too.

Maybe one free queue dodge a day for ranked games with higher punishments for ranked queue dodges after that free one is used?

Only for ranked, I really don't think it should be necessary for normal. Just a half-hearted suggestion.
yeah u can have an autofill system or u can have an average of 30 mins per game queue time. Your call

> [{quoted}](name=dKiWi,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gkYx6cVA,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-01-03T23:27:42.164+0000)
>
> yeah u can have an autofill system or u can have an average of 30 mins per game queue time. Your call

30 minutes for midlaners :P
Top, Support and ADC tend to be open, and jg is just...meh

Enjoy eating either a loss of your ELO, time, or likely a combination of both.

You can't dodge or you automatically lose your series and some LP, and if you have to do it twice in a day, that's a 30 min lockout of time wasted.  If the game starts, you are forced to play through two people feeding, and if you decide to do something more worthwhile with your time, you lose access to rewards, and possibly eat a ban because someone else decided to ruin 4 peoples' game.

Honestly this community has literally changed me as a person and I am much more cynical and distrusting of people after being subject to shit like the OP's experience for years on a near-constant basis.
